page.title: 12The games children play.
page.content: Children play chasing games, variations of hide and seek, ball games, skipping etc. One is called elastics. You tie together the ends of a long piece of a elastic. Two children stand inside and stretch the elastic into an oblong with their legs. Then those outside have a turn to do a series of jumps with the elastic stretched wide or allowed near together, held low around the ankles or higher around knees or thighs. If you make a mistake by not doing the correct order of jumps, standing or not standing when you should etc, someone else has a turn at jumping and you hold an "end" of the elastic. When your turn comes round again you carry on from where you left off. The winner is the person who is most far ahead in the jumps.
